etymologies: late 17th century: from French, from Anglo-Norman French siwte (see suit)

definitions: a set of rooms designated for one person's or family's use or for a particular purpose
shortDefinitions: set of rooms designated for one person's or family's use or for particular purpose

examples.text: there is plenty of space for a dining table and a three-piece suite

shortDefinitions: set of furniture of same design

definitions: a set of instrumental compositions, originally in dance style, to be played in succession.
shortDefinitions: set of instrumental compositions to be played in succession

definitions: a set of selected pieces from an opera or musical, arranged to be played as one instrumental work.
shortDefinitions: set of selected pieces from opera

definitions: a group of people in attendance on a monarch or other person of high rank

examples.text: the Royal Saloon was built for the use of the Queen and her suite

shortDefinitions: group of people in attendance on monarch

definitions: a set of programs with a uniform design and the ability to share data.
shortDefinitions: set of programs with uniform design

definitions: a group of minerals, rocks, or fossils occurring together and characteristic of a location or period

examples.text: potassic rock suites are a characteristic feature of the area

shortDefinitions: group of minerals, rocks, or fossils occurring together and characteristic of location or period
